roleset.name: come to a close, cause to stop
roleset.note: END-V NOTES: VN updated by Julia. Member of Vncls stop-55.4-1. (from end.01-v)
END-N NOTES: Updated by Julia. Member of Vncls stop-55.4-1. (from end.01-n)
ENDING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-5, end-v.01. Correspond to Vncls stop-55.4-1. (from ending.01-n)

roles.note: No examples found with agents or instruments-- they seem slightly awkward, but I'm not ruling out their possibility. Most instances contain only arg1, and occasionally MNR. (from end.01-n)

role.descr: Subevent or thing that Arg1 ends with

example.name: nominal arg1
example.text: [The courts]-1 want *trace*-1 to end rigid affirmative action programs.

example.name: accusative, arg1 NP
example.text: Such a countermove could end Jaguar's hopes for independence.

example.name: ergative
example.text: The huge bronze bells...end, surprisingly, in the inverted position.
example.arg: [The huge bronze bells...][in the inverted position]

example.name: different kind of instrument
example.text: The first two GAF trials ended in mistrials earlier this year.

example.name: autogen1
example.text: By Richterian standards , the show that the Oakland Athletics puton Friday and Saturday nights , in putting a mercifully swift endto the game 's Longest Short Series , rated somewhere between a10 and an 11 .
example.arg: to the game 's Longest Short Series

example.name: autogen2
example.text: he awaits his end in a prison cell

example.name: all args
example.text: What I favor about Crichton's style is his ending the novel with a bibliography and a chapter with some ideas on correcting the issues he presented in the book.
example.arg: with a bibliography and a chapter with some ideas on correcting the issues he presented in the book

roleset.name: valuation at the end of a trading period, especially stocks
roleset.note: END-V NOTES: Frames file for 'end' based on survey of initial 100 or so sentences from big corpus. (from end.02-v predicate notes)

example.name: two senses at once?
example.text: Japan's No. 111 4.6% bond due 1998 ended the day on brokers' screens at 95.11 [*-1] to yield 5.43%.

example.name: cash surplus
example.text: Sea Containers would end up with a cash surplus of approx. $620 million.
example.arg: with a cash surplus of approx. $620 million

example.name: data
example.text: That data could end up in the hands of prosecutors

example.name: false prediction
example.text: Time Warner and Sony Corp could end up becoming partners.

roleset.name: hit the back of a car
roleset.note: REAR_END-V NOTES: Based on Thyme and Sharp data. Comparison to hit.01. Framed by Katie. (from end.04-v)

example.name: metonymic example
example.text: I read-ended him with my dad's Beamer.
